question: Does inhibition or scavenging of peroxynitrite prevent the induction of T cell tolerance? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Nitration of TCR-CD8 is induced by MDSCs through hyperproduction of reactive oxygen species and peroxynitrite during direct cell-cell contact.
content.source_2: In co-culture assays, CD8+ T-cell tolerance induced by MDSCs was unchanged by peroxynitrite scavengers, indicating that tolerance can be established without peroxynitrite despite robust ROS production.
content.source_3: By inducing peroxynitrite-dependent nitration of the TCRâ€“CD8 complex, MDSCs alter antigen recognition and drive the induction of CD8+ T-cell tolerance in cancer.
content.source_4: In tumor-bearing mice, selective inhibition of peroxynitrite formation or genetic disruption of NOS2 did not prevent the onset of T-cell tolerance; instead, blockade of arginase activity reversed hyporesponsiveness, pointing to a peroxynitrite-independent mechanism.
